Reviews.Title: “Den for lowlifes, prostitutes and drug dealers...........”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the holidays and booked this place online.....it looked ok from the pictures, but when we got there it was terrible.....there were people standing around everywhere.......nothing worked....it was filthy.....I witnessed a drug deal in front of our room and had a prostitute proposition me on the way to my car.......we only stayed one night and that was enough.....ended up sleeping on inflatable mattress at my inlaws house and it was actually better than that dump.....never go there and the city of indianapolis should be ashamed of its self and tear this place down....

Reviews.Title: “Never seen such terrible condition”
Reviews.Author: Gwen T
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a birthday celebration and the room was booked by my cousin. The room was dirty, One of the beds was broke. We couldn't get the clean towels we needed. And the bath tubdrain was clogged. There were stains on the sheets. Microwave only worked when you selected soup. Hall way lights were out. NEVER! I do mean never stay at this hotel. It shouldn't even be open for bussines. I should've made other accomodations .

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapponting”
Reviews.Author: lks1957
Reviews.Content: We prepaid our promising reservation made through Southwest.com at this hotel, only to arrive after an airline delay and discover that the very young man at the desk could not find our PREPAID reservation. He did check us in however, to a room in which everything was dirty, stained, or broken. The pools were closed, the carpets were worn and dirty, there was no elevator so this 50+ cancer patient hauled her own luggage up stairs. Had I not prepaid, and had there not been signs all over the place that there would be no refunds, I would have left that night. Even Cavalier's own night clerks informed us it was dangerous to park in one of their parking lots. We could hear voices from other rooms in the middle of the night, and I just did not feel safe, especially since the night latch did not work in our room. Then there was the the dead bud in the room. Enough said...

Reviews.Title: “It was the worst”
Reviews.Author: tweet1956
Reviews.Content: It was the worst, we had to change rooms 3 times. The 1st room only had 1 bed, I paid for 2 queens. The 2nd had a bug bomb and dead bugs in it, that should have told me bad news. The 3rd looked ok no queen beds only fulls, they said they have no 2 queens in a room, they lied to me. When we got up ready to leave the next day, I had bugs on my pillow,YUK The pool was broke and no cofee pot or no resturant or bar which they show in their ad.

Reviews.Title: “THE NEXT TIME I WILL STAY IN MY CAR”
Reviews.Author: wsimm13075
Reviews.Content: i ended up at the place as part of hotel/flight package deal. Did not check the reviews. Saw the picture and thought I would be alright. WRONG. What I saw with my eyes did not match what I saw on my computer screen. The pictures apparently are fron the hotels days as a part of a national chain. In short - the place is a dump. Carpet dirty and stained. Did not have a comfortable night sleep while I was there. Cobwebs in common areas. After I got there and I saw what I was dealing with I went to the CVS across the street to get some spray disinfectant. Virtual no maintenance. Card keys would not work properly. Half of the lamps in my room were missing light bulbs. Staff insensitive. There are a lot of good hotels in Indianapolis. Some in close proximity to this one. If I were to go back to Indianapolis and this was the only hotel that had a vacancy I would stay in my car or sleep under a bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Umm? And that is clean?”
Reviews.Author: awilder32
Reviews.Content: Well i must say, when entering into the hotel the inside lobby does look like the pictures online, well kept up, but once you reach the desk look left and look right... you can tell that the lobby is the only thing kept clean. Everything promised online was no longer "avaliable". Not breakfast, no room service, no pool. It is "under new management". Well the manager must have never read their handbook because that place is HORRIBLE. Lets get to the uncleansly part shall we? My room... the bed was made, however Im CERTAIN not with clean sheets, the tub still had dirt spots, there was trash still in my trash can, and to top it off,,, THERE WAS A BAG WITH PISSED CLOTHES STILL IN MY DRESSER! When I called to speak with them on this... they told me there was nothing the could do they were under "new management". They called back to the room and said i could have a full refund, which they do not giver by the way, although it does say they do online if you tell them by 6 pm, THEY DONT. But they said I could have a full refund but OH YEAH it was the week of BLACK EXPO and all hotels were full. GREAT! Also they wont tell you that they rent out their little ball room that is in the middle of the hotel that everyone can see and hear anything going on in their room. Well there was some hispanic party that had no range limit of noise level, so I heard spanish music blasting until 1 am. And then the next day, sunday, surprise surprise PRAISE AND WORSHIP! So do not stay at the hotel, and if so, bring disinfectant, which i did buy, bring mr clean, ear plugs and your own sheets, blanket and pillow, because when room service came she put my cover and sheets on the floor and remade my bed.... WITH THE SAME STUFF.

Reviews.Title: “It just doesn't stop!!”
Reviews.Author: mefoster76
Reviews.Content: We actually didn't stay at this hotel, we stayed at their sister hotel one exit past the Indiana Live Casino in Plainfield. You'll note that the pictures on Hotel.com are actually of the hotel behind the actual motel - that look amazingly like this on.e It was much like the reviews here. The place was awful and my 12 year old daughter is still making fun of me for booking this roach motel. Our room was never cleaned and when they did come and take the towel they never left us new clean ones. That is to replace the 1 wash cloth that they left us (mind you there were 4 in our party). There was no phone in the room, the furniture had holes drilled in the top of them, and there was a stained mattress in the dumpster. It smelled terrible probably from the mouse poop that was in the drawers. Most of the people that were staying there, I believe actually probably lived there - one man at our 35 minute check in was there to pay his "rent" his words not mine. Upon complaining to the manager she gave me a comp to their sister hotel...Cavalier...telling me that it was a four star hotel. My boyfriend and I thought hey we could use it for the Brickyard 400 and spend an extra night in Indy seeing the sights. I am SO glad that I looked at this first! After three nights in their sister hotel, I wouldn't want to take my health into risk again. Lucky for us we have strong immune systems, or I'm sure we would have needed an antibiotic!! My biggest regret is that now I have spent $150 and was looking forward to an extra night - only to see that it just isn't in the cards!!

Reviews.Title: “TEAR IT DOWN, PLEASE! JUST AWFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeriousAsHell
Reviews.Content: UNBELIEVABLE! I booked this room through Hotwire and didn't see these reviews until AFTER I paid for the stay. I thought, "well, it IS a Ramada so it can't be THAT bad, right? B.S.! This place is soooo bad that in all honesty it should be condemned. And, it probably would be condemned if someone from the city of Indianapolis would take seriously their job to protect the public - especially visitors to their lovely city from sickness and possible disease/harm. I'm being very serious folks. This place is the ABSOLUTE WORST PLACE I'VE EVER BEEN IN as far as hotels and motels go. PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU VALUE YOUR FAMILY'S SAFETY AND HEALTH. Aside from everyone else's issues, most of which I am in full understanding and thus agreement with, here are my own issues: 1. Exposed Electrical Circuitry at Outlets. 2. Awful smell of smoke in a "NON-Smoking" room. 3. No cover on bathtub drain with a sharp metal object protruding up from the floor of bathtub. Had to be careful not to catch and cut foot. 4. Clogged vanity sink. 5. Dirty and Stained Towels. 6. Overall filthy appearance and smell. 7. Simply DISGUSTING! PLEASE, STAY AWAY. P.S. If anyone from Indianapolis reads this, you should take enough pride in your lovely city (serious comment) to have something done about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest place I have ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: beefy725
Reviews.Content: I really wish I listened to the reviews. This place was the dirtiest place I have ever seen in my life. There was a piece of wood holding up the corner of the sink. Carpets where stained. The bathroom was the worst part. There was mold in the bathroom, the tub it self was brown with stains. You could see mold growing in the bathroom along with the ceiling that looked like it was caving it. We actually went to a local store to buy flip flops to shower with. Which we finally could not bring ourselves to shower at the hotel so went to the in laws. When I complained they actually moved us to a room that was worse then the first. They showed me a total of 7 rooms each worse then the one before it. Tried to watch TV but it was mostly static. The only thing that was decedent in the hotel was the beds. The sheets were clean and the bed was comfy. Common area's were trashed with kids in the pool at 2AM. I heard a bunch of dogs barking all night. I do have pictures I will share with anyone who would like them. Feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing "Cavalier" about this place!”
Reviews.Author: TexShel
Reviews.Content: I booked through expedia my entire trip. This seemed to be the worst part. When we checked in they did not ask for ID or anything, just told them our name and they gave us a paper to sign in. There was local police sitting in the parking lot going through the hotel register of guests, kind of creepy! Guessing there is someone they were looking for? The room had a funky smell. It was HOT in there, the A/C did not work. There was a coffee pot, but no coffee making things. No cups for water. There was one of the ladies that works at the desk walking around eating all 3 times I seen her! I do want to note that the public area where the pool and sitting area was very pretty. I am sure pets are allowed because there were many barking dogs and cats in many of the windows

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: wewie49
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotels for Everyone. I did read some of the reviews, but like others, did not pay much attention. The rate was so cheap, and I am not really picky, so I took a chance. After all, It IS a Ramada Inn! Luckily, after checking in, my husband suggested that we look at the room before taking in our bags. We immediately got back in the car and found a room about a block away at the Holiday Inn Express. It was twice the money, but absolutely worth it. This place should be shut down or burned to the ground. Do not ignore the reviews. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ummm...”
Reviews.Author: giraffe23
Reviews.Content: Well I didn't quite have the experience that some of the other guests have experienced. We stayed there due to the "24 hour airport shuttle with nonstop service" that was advertised on their website and the great deal they were offering. Well, it isn't nonstop service, you have to schedule it. And the front desk staff did not notify the driver so when we went to the front desk (thankfully a little early) in the morning they had to call her. It was no problem and very early and the driver was very pleasant despite the early hour. Front desk staff was always very friendly. They gave us the wrong keys the first time and it was easily changed. The shared accomodation areas (conference center, pool, etc.) looked pretty nice and in decent shape. Our room was an outside room, which is not ideal and probably would have stopped us from booking but whatever. The room was...not good. There was stained furniture and the bathroom wasn't too clean. I took a shower with my sandals on and had my husband do a sponge bath, figuring he would be dirtier for getting in the actual shower. The sheets looked clean and the bed was fine. We didn't watch too much television, so can't comment on that. The hotel has it's ups and for us the airport transfer was one of those. Their shuttle actually goes all over the city and is conveniently located, so nice for out-of-town travelers who don't want to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES”
Reviews.Author: Prencie
Reviews.Content: I didnt listento the reviews, whe i should have!! First the tv was horrible!Then my son left 3 ps3 games and remote in drawer in room which they found and had at front desk but when i got there to pick them up they told me they were gone already!! I HAVENT HEARD FROM THEM BUT THEY HAVE NOT HEARD THE LAST OF ME!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: theplayergirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first week of august and lets just say it was horriable, i didnt get what i paid for and i was really upset. The only good thing about this stay was the front desk lady i believe her name was sara she helped me out so much and didnt even complain. My daughter needed ice because she had scratched her leg and sara was the first one helping us with a bandaid and ice. If it wasnt for sara i wouldve packed up and left within the first hour. I appreciate all sara's work and i hope she stays around because without her the hotel would go down!

Reviews.Title: “THE DIRTIEST, SKETCHIEST, WORST HOTEL EVER! SLEEP IN YOUR CAR.”
Reviews.Author: JBDC40
Reviews.Content: This is the most horrible dump of a hotel I've ever had the displeasure of staying in. The general appearance of the entrance way and parking lot makes the property appear to be a remnant of a burned-out urban strip b/c the lot is sort of empty and torn up with weeds growing through the asphalt of part of it. The lobby was deceptively well-appointed. The check-in process took over 50 minutes when there were 3 people in front of me checking in, one of which was making incredibly intricate arrangements to rent multiple rooms for 2 weeks, while paying for some of the rooms for just 2 nights, others for just one, with more payment to follow. Another guest came to the desk and complained twice that his key was mis-programmed and he couldn't get into his room. This guy was very vocal and complained loudly that the hotel needed to get maintenance on-sight to fix the key programming machine and was convincing the people in line in front of me that their keys weren't going to work. The one woman working at the desk was trying to keep her cool but there was NO ONE helping her. She called the manager twice and told him she needed help and she needed someone from maintenance. The manager never showed up but after about 15 minutes some guy who evidently was from maintenance showed up although he did not look like an official maintenance person at all. When I finally got to the front of the line I asked for a first floor, Non-Smoking room b/c I had lots of luggage to bring into the room but none were available. I was assigned to a second floor room to which I went, and luckily the key worked but the room REEKED of smoke AND the toilet wouldn't flush. I went back to the front desk and asked for another room, but those same 2 people who had taken so much time to rent all those rooms for two weeks while I was in line previously WERE BACK and taking another 15 minutes to partially pay for some of the rooms for portions of the 2 weeks. While I waited in line, the woman who had been in front of me initially waiting to check-in came back to request another room too because there were "bugs in the bathroom" of her room. During this return for another room poor Allison was at the front desk STILL and STILL had no help. So when I finally got to the front of the line I told her about the problems with the first room and she assigned me to another, which now magically was on the 1st floor where there were no such rooms available only 20 minutes previously. I went to the newly assigned room, where the toilet flushed, but although there was a non-smoking icon on the door this room also STANK to high-heaven! I had been driving for 7 hours and was exhausted so I unloaded the car figuring that all the rooms must be just as terrible. I then went immediately to CVS for air freshener and neutralizer to make it tolerable. One of the wall lights didn't work; the floor lamp behind the chair was bent and stood at an angle almost propped up by the upholstered chair; the curtains and sheers were stained and torn and not hung regularly on the rod; there was a huge brown smear of something on the wall above the mirror and below some nasty stained ceiling tiles; the wall-mounted iron/ironing board holder was halfway hanging off the wall with one of the screws not present; the ironing board cover was stained; the bathroom had dead bugs on the floor behind the door and tons of cigarette burns on the edge of the tub; there was no drain stopper and looking into the drain I could see hair and string hanging on the cross bars inside the drain; there was only one washcloth; the lightbulb hardware under the shade of one of the bedside lamps was bent so badly that the bulb was touching the shade creating a fire hazard; and the carpet was totally sticky. And that was just the room! The grounds and general appearance of the larger property were equally as abysmal. The entry parking lot was very sketchy, as I mentioned, and the parking lot around back and on the sides of the building was in poor condition; there were cigarette butts all over the parking lot; there were two porch chairs in a parking space in the back as if some people were living there; there was litter everywhere; the laundry room was dark and in disarray, including one washer/dryer that was totally disassembled and askew from the wall; the carpeting in the foyer area outside the laundry room was torn up; the grass in the courtyard around the pool was un-mowed and full of weeds and cigarette butts; the concrete walkways were old and cracked and in one section it looked as if some kind of excavation was taking place with a big pile of concrete pieces piled up; and there was a wooden desk sitting out in the middle of the courtyard in the weeds. There was also a very old, faded piece of kids playground equipment out there but I wouldn't have let any child of mine climb on it. I don't know how this place could be redeemed without a TOTAL makeover. This Ramada was a remarkable dump except for the lobby. And I have pictures if you'd care to see them. I would never stay in this place again. It was so filthy that my travel companion and I were scared to even try out the pool or the restaurant. It was THAT dirty. And instead of parking near my room I parked my car directly under a streetlight in the empty front parking lot which was visible from a major road. I was surprised no one tried to break into it. I am not a fussy person, but this place was HORRIBLE. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay !”
Reviews.Author: zulu029
Reviews.Content: Have to say I've heard and read horror stories, but, honestly We had a very enjoyable stay. staff very friendly and willing to go the extra mile for me and my family, The pool was refreshing and the staff was there to make sure things were ok, towels, drinks, etc. I do admit the hotel is not new but the extras offered and location made our stay worth it . I also understand after reading a lot of these reviews most people thought they were in a 5 star hotel and paying 300.00 a night for it .. and that a lot of travelers feel the need to complain about life rather than make the best of it ..

Reviews.Title: “The remainder of a once nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunstoked
Reviews.Content: The hotel building itself is actually quite nice, even though it is in what seems to be a shady area. There is a nice atrium area that has a place to sit and hang out with a pool. The hotel was also very quiet, almost to the point of wondering if anyone else was staying there. The rooms were dated and a little run down, but if it had ended there i would have been fine considering the deal we got on the room. The whole hotel honestly looked like there hadn't been a cleaning crew there in about six months. There were pizza boxes and garbage stacked up next to the garbage cans. There were plates from the buffet breakfast still on the table at 6pm. The pool had dirty towels laying around it and the guest bathroom near the pool was flooded and had wet clothes in it; the light didnt work, so we had to find this out the hard way. After swimming for awhile we went back to our room to get ready for the day and when we came back, the pool had been shut down by the health department. Overall, bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “BeWare”
Reviews.Author: Mommy123Mommy123
Reviews.Content: Currently I rented two rooms for my daughter’s birthday. If I didn’t have 6 little girls looking forward to swimming, I would have left. This hotel was disgusting! The rooms were in horrible condition. 1. The carpet was stained and ripped. Our room had food and someone’s toenails or fingernails on the floor around the bed. 2. The room smelled like an ashtray 3. The curtains, blinds and lampshades were stained yellow with smoke. 4. The paint on the walls, chipping and stained with dirt. 5. Bathroom floor was dirty, toilet and shower dirty. 6. Half roll of toilet paper in each room. We ran out. 7. Refrigerator didn’t work, had to ask for replacement 8. Some of the outlets in the room were pulled out with the wiring showing. 9. Blood or something of the same coloring on the mattress and on back of bathroom door. 10. Coffee makers in room didn’t work. 11. Glass on patio was dirty with hand prints and dirt. There is no way that the hotel passes code. The Indiana Health Department needs to inspect these rooms. I’m amazed someone can run and keep open a hotel in this condition. The pictures on the web site are miss leading.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: busybee43
Reviews.Content: Oh my DO NOT stay here, this place is really nasty and I have pictures if you would like to see. the carpet was stained in my room the toilet was soooooooo nasty I was afraid to use it this place is totally run down and dont waste your money when I checked in they only had one guy to answer phone and check people in and he couldnt speak good english I was about 35 minutes to check in it was late afternoon no rooms were ready so went and killed some time over an hour he gave me a key said the room was cleaned it wasnt so he gave me another room oh what a mess all they have is a breakfast bar it cost 4.50 no place to really talk about in the hotel to eat they have a tiny room to order drinks or food it was inside but waaaaaaay too cold to sit there and eat. I had an inside room close to pool and hot tub parents just let their kids loose inside and do whatever they wanted they were tearing up the pool and hot tub no way I could get in either and it was too cold in there anyway just take my advice and dont stay here

Reviews.Title: “Sucked big time don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: letmeshop
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We were suppose to have an Atrium room and ended up in the back of the hotel and that is not very safe for a mother and daughter to be at night. Our air only worked on high and then it got to cold and we tried to warm it up but the heat did not work. The floors were dirty, the hall was dirty and hot because there was not air on. There was no security doors anyone could just walk in and go where they wanted. The staff seemed to be more interested in there own personal issues than ours and when we asked for more toilet paper it took forever for house keeping to get to us then they wanted to clean our room but keep looking at my purse and our stuff like they were scoping out what they wanted to take when we left so needless to say we took everything with us when we left for a while. I tried to complain but all the girl did was write my name down and tell me I should have said something before checking out which I did when I checked in but no one listened. Please listen and do not stay in this hotel it is not worth it and there are other more decent hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: loverslanelodge
Reviews.Content: We made the big mistake of staying the weekend at this dump and while we were their some one on the staff their stole my wedding ring and anniversary ring right ot of our room.The owner refused to help us and even had an employee call and advise me not to ever call them again about my rings!!! They told us they were reporting it to the police that my rings were missing but never bothered to call them. So if you value your possitions I WOUND NOT EVER STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sukhdeep_no_1
Reviews.Content: I came to indianapolis i stayed in this hotel grand veiw inn its not very pleasent but its ok and its worth of my money. I had enjoyed the swiming in the indoor pool and sauna which was easy to find right next to the pool. And ive seen a lot of people working in the the atrium, pool and resturant and i talked to one of the hotel staff and i they are going through a majour renevataion in and out side of the hotel. And i heard that it is going to be called RAMADA INN & SUITES in may 2008. With the canges going on in this hotel it will be nice. visit there website: www.clarionindy.com

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: camsbaby12
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I reserved a room here, and when we got there, the hotel looked run down and when we checked in they told us the pool got closed down by the "health board" and when we got into our room we had 4 tv channels, the bed was small, there were burns on the dresser and lights. Just all and all the room was awful. I would not recommend any-one to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Once A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: shonyg2001
Reviews.Content: March 14, 2008 I Stayed at the Grand View Inn and Suites. I was amazed when I arrived at the property dispite the bad comments I have heard from friends that it wasnt all that bad. The hotel is currently going through remodeling. At one time im sure this place was booming. Grand View has an indoor pool, a bar and restaurant. Im sure in June when they have their grand opening busiiness will be booming once again. I enjoyed my stay Friday night. My kids and I enjoyed the swimming pool all the way until closing it was very peaceful. I would love to see the property once everything gets going In june.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: sports18girl
Reviews.Content: My softball team needed a hotel to stay at for the state tournament. The coaches found this hotel and didn't think it was too bad and they offered us a deal. It was, in fact, not a deal at all. Check in took a good 30 minutes. After a softball game us 10 girls wanted to relax. When we got in our rooms we were grossed out. We decided to go to the pool. Once again grossed out. We needed some towels, none to be found by the pool. The phone by the pool worked, suprisingly, and we called for towels only to be told that we had to come get them. When we asked for 10 towels, the 16 year old girl said shed try to find that many. Back in our rooms no one would sit on the floor, it looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in weeks. Showering scared me. As one girl said she felt like she was in the movie Psycho. The tub was dirty and there was a hole in the ceiling. That night a couple girls and I didn't sleep under the blankets. We didn't even look under there. Then at about 4 in the morning my roommates and I woke hearing someone walking past our room back and forth for about an hour. I also should mention that people live there and stink up the buliding with their smoke. Probably why someone was up at 4 am, most likely high. We woke up and went downstairs for breakfast to find a few hard donuts,orange juice ,and coffee that had been there since we got there. Then we all got together and decided that we want to change hotels. We had planned on staying there 4 nights and only stayed one. We changed to the Super 8 down the street. We payed more, but the move was well worth it. We only used 5 rooms and later were charged for 7. We called to handle this and never recieved a call back. 3 star hotel??? I think not. I wouldn't give it any stars, in fact it should be shut down

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money on this place!!”
Reviews.Author: midwestgirl75
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. Check in was a little painful, because they are clearly under staffed. But that is nothing compared to the false advertisement of this hotel online. It is not a 3 star or even a 2 star hotel. Ma ybe a 1/2 star! There is not a restaurant or bar open in this establishment. (as advertised at booking) There is no night club. It appears to be that there once was signs of these...but no more. There is an outdoor pool which was old and dirty. A indoor pool that was small and a little cleaner but overall dangerously outdated. The jacuzzi isn't very warm, but it was clean. Sauna? Never could find it. The finess room was closed down. The "game room" has 3 arcade games. Now to the actual room.....the carpet is dirty and worn. stained is putting it mildly. The tub was full of mildew. The shower curtain was too. The Tv remote didn't work. The blanket on the bed had cigarette burns all over it.....which we stripped from the bed. I can say the sheets were clean. I actually bought lysol to spray the room. I would have NEVER stayed in this room if every other hotel in Indy wasn't already booked due to the Nascar race. I could go on and on complaining, but trust me this is no 3 star hotel. It is a run down glorified drug dealing motel. It appears that there are regulars that live at the grand view. Partying went on until 4am....not a place for a family. STAY AWAY from Grand View Inn Suites/Indy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: f1fan11
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The cockroaches, the mould, or my personal favorite the used hypodermic needles we found in our 'upgraded' room. The front desk help was a 15 year old girl who talked to her boyfriend instead of helping people,and a hotel staff knocked on our door and gave us some 'clean' towels out of a garbage bag and said we were lucky to get them! I forgot to mention the hugh fist fight amoungst some guests that ended up with someone being thrown through a window. Cereal at the 'buffett breakfast' was stored in an open cabinet on the floor (that was so sticky you could bearly walk on it) just so the cockroaches wouldn't have to climb too far. Donuts were 3 days old at least. Don't ever stay here - no matter how cheap it is!!

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: woody412
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the biggest waste of money. Rooms where in terrible shape, and cleaning crew, if you saw them, didn't care. Have to chase them down for towels and even toilet paper. Air doesn't work and heat was on even though it was in the 60's and 70's. Some staff lives on premises and have pets and small kids, as well as cooking all the time, causing smoke to build in hallways, no ventilation to get it out. Desk staff among the most uncaring and rude ever encountered. Do yourself a favor, Sleep in your car.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Bad on customer relations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My visit to this motel was during this year Labor Day Weekend. Upon arriving home from a two night stay, I noticed that I had left my personal pillow at the motel. Luckly I had picked you one of their business cards with their information listed. Hoping that I might return for another stay. I first call the 800 number and got a desk clerk and she told me I would have to talk to a Anna. I called the next day, got a desk clerk and asked to speek to Anna. The first clerk gave me the time to call Ann for the next day. In which I did. No Anna. I began to question the second clerk about my pillow. She informed me that house keeping had the pillow, down to the description of the pillow. This peocedure resulted in NO responce from Anna. Now I e-mailed to the motel telling them the story not once but twice. As of this date NO responce. Now my wife and myself are planning a four day trip to Indianapolis IN in May of next year. Guess I'l be looking for a Motel that needs and appreciates my Money. I still would like to have the pillow! Alan

Reviews.Title: “Horrific hotel!!!!!!!11”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start....How about having to switch rooms 4 times, finally getting settled at 930pm! Our room along with all others were 85 degrees with NO AIR...well except for the 1/2 working box fan the gave us. Rooms were dirty and appliances did not work(i.e. snot rags in cushions of chairs, broken toilets, broken hairdryers, ect.) And to top things off, the second story floor had windows wide open with NO screens in them along side the hallway that many young children were running up and down. Then when we finally got cooled down enough to sleep, we asked for extra pillows, but never received them. Needless to say, I set my own alarm @ 630am to check out ASAP. Don't waste your money. And don't use Hotels to book your hotel either. We could not even get a refund

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have always assumed that with the name Ramada, you would get a great room. Not so with this one. The front desk clerk kepts us waiting through 3 very long phone calls even though we had been there first to check in. When we got to the room it was okay but had a very unpleasant smell in spots. I sprayed my perfume to try to mask the odor. The front desk clerk told us the restaurant was open but when we got there the bartender informed us it was closed. The hotel advertised a game and excersize room. Both were closed and locked. The pool was okay. The jacuzzi needed major cleaning! The poolside table we sat at was sticky and had dried food all over it. I had booked this hotel for another night on our return trip but needless to say I cancelled! Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed a total of 20 minutes.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've been in, without question. Hotel - no. It's more like a motel. The front desk clerk said the conference was "somewhere in those three rooms" and didn't even make any effort to find out where. Her response was "I don't know!" Ceiling tiles in the bathroom were disgusting. Rust was all over the t-bar holding up the ceiling tiles. The tub was dirty. They claim it is a 3-star hotel. Hogwash. This is fraudulent misrepresentation. It's a one star motel. A night in your car will be a better decision. The previous poster was correct. Indianapolis is a beautiful city. The Indianapolis residents are great. But, as for hotels (motels), stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a budget hotel, but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have had two experiences with this hotel. I will start with the most recent. I attended this hotel July 18-20. Complaints first: I was able to receive early check-in. Upon entering my room, I noticed a damp musky order. I borrowed some air freshener from housekeeping. The last time I stayed at this hotel, I travel with a group (10/02) and we had the same problem with some of the rooms. The thermostat was not working. They figured that no one would use it in the summer, but it was so cold in the room, due to the fan being on full blast prior to our arrival, we wanted it to warm up fast. Two years earlier, I remembered that my friend had been in this room, 209 I believe and the heat did not work then. The room was old, stains on ceiling, spots on walls, and we had only one set of towels to use. I called front desk and they told me to call housekeeping. I left my request on voice mail and the towels were never received. I ended up doing like the previous poster and getting towels from the front desk. The buffett that was available was not good. Save some money and go across the street to Dennys or Bob Evans. On the previous occasion we encountered a rude waitress, thank God she seemed to be gone. We requested a do not disturb sign and placed it on the door. When we left the hotel, we still had it on. Housekeeping entered our room, and lo and behold brought the missing towels a whole 24hrs later. The outdoor, indoor, and jacuzzi pools were very nice. We heard the front desk deny early check in because they were fully booked and needed to clean rooms-not true, and housekeeping really didn't do a great job of cleaning the ones that they supposedly had cleaned. Since I am not high maitenence, I will stay at this hotel again, but mainly for two reasons the price and the shuttle drivers. The shuttle drivers are so friendlt they make you want to come back again. The fact that this hotel has shuttle service is a great assett. They will take you anywhere for free, and offer to pick you up. We arrived by Greyhound in Indianapolis and they even picked us up then. Much cheaper than a cab and less annoying then "Event" downtown traffic. The pool table, club, and pools are a great asset as well. It is beautiful on the surface, but needs a lot of renovation.
